intro: Erythroxylum shatona, commonly known as the Shatoná coca, is a perennial shrub native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the Erythroxylaceae family and is characterized by its lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, white flowers. The plant produces small, elliptical berries that contain seeds, and it is known for its presence of alkaloids, particularly cocaine. It thrives in high-altitude environments with cool temperatures and well-drained soil.
